author: mysanantonio.com
title: Coming Attractions in San Antonio -
text:
Photo: Warner Bros. Image 1 of / 1 1 Hugh Jackman and Levi Miller in “Pan.”
Photo: Warner Bros. Hugh Jackman and Levi Miller in “Pan.” Coming Attractions in San Antonio 1 / 1 Back to Gallery Oct. 9
He Named Me Malala: Documentary pays tribute to Malala Yousafzai, who as a teenager in Pakistan spoke out on behalf of education for girls and was rewarded with a bullet to the head. She survived to become a worldwide advocate for children’s rights.
99 Homes: Set amid the bursting of the 2008 housing bubble, this thriller stars Michael Shannon as a real-estate broke whose job is to foreclose on homes and Andrew Garfield as a handyman who agrees to help Shannon in order to stave off his own eviction. Ramin Bahraini ’s film is getting great reviews (92 Tomatometer score) since its limited release last week.
Pan: The latest take on J.M. Barrie ’s classic tale of the boy who never grew up is a prequel/origin story that begins in World War II era England. Levi Miller is Peter, a 12-year-old whose destiny begins to be realized when he’s scooped up by Blackbeard ( Hugh Jackman ), who’s bound for Neverland. Garrett Hedlund is Hook; Rooney Mara is Tiger Lily. British director Joe Wright ’s resume includes the heartbreaking “Atonement” (2007) and a well-reviewed “Pride and Prejudice” (2005).
